alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 5:04PM EST until February 18 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following river in Kentucky... Levisa Fork at Pikeville affecting Pike County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Levisa Fork at Pikeville. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 32.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 33.6 feet this evening. - Action stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next statement will be issued by midnight tonight.
